item.title: Un ataque militar en Irán podría tener un propósito simbólico para Trump
item.description: Algunos funcionarios del gobierno de Trump esperan que un ataque obligue a Irán a renunciar a su programa de enriquecimiento nuclear. Otros tienen dudas.
item.dc:creator: Julian E. Barnes and Helene Cooper
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Arms Control and Limitation and Disarmament

media:content.media:description: Aviones de combate estadounidenses en el portaaviones Gerald R. Ford, frente a la costa de Grecia. El ejército estadounidense está acumulando potencia de fuego en la región cercana a Irán.

item.title: Word of the Day: interpolate
item.description: This word has appeared in three articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: Trump’s Shields Are Down
item.description: Personnel once meant policy; now it means flattery.
item.dc:creator: Carlos Lozada
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Photo illustration by The New York Times; source photographs by Associated Press, Reuters and Getty Images

item.title: Amid Rhetoric About Rupture With U.S., Finland Urges Calm
item.description: “We don’t need a bulldozer,” says Alexander Stubb, Finland’s president and a golf partner of President Trump. “Reform doesn’t mean destruction.”
item.dc:creator: Steven Erlanger

media:content.media:credit: Saara Mansikkamaki for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Alexander Stubb of Finland, last year. Mr. Stubb says he recognizes that the world has changed, perhaps forever, and that Europe is not Washington’s priority.

item.title: El cambio de régimen en Cuba atrae a Trump, pero conlleva riesgos
item.description: Tras exigir el fin del liderazgo comunista de la isla, el presidente de EE. UU. espera llegar a un acuerdo con el gobierno cubano para evitar el caos.
item.dc:creator: Michael Crowley

media:content.media:description: El presidente de Cuba, Miguel Díaz-Canel, en el centro, dijo a un periódico estatal que el país no se arrodilla.

item.title: India Built the World’s Back Office. A.I. Is Starting to Shrink It.
item.description: Artificial intelligence promises to automate the white-collar work that made India a tech powerhouse. The country is racing to adapt before it’s too late.
item.dc:creator: Steven Lee Myers, Paul Mozur and Saumya Khandelwal

media:content.media:description: Hunar.AI is offering companies bespoke A.I. voice agents that steer job applicants through virtually every step of the hiring process.

item.title: With a New Nigeria Refinery, Africa’s Richest Man Wants ‘to Rescue the Country’
item.description: Aliko Dangote, Africa’s richest man, has an ambitious vision for the continent’s most populous nation, but hurdles stand in his way.
item.dc:creator: Dionne Searcey

media:content.media:credit: Victor Adewale for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Aliko Dangote at home in Lagos, Nigeria, last month.

item.title: Trump’s Foreign Policy: Resurrecting Empire
item.description: President Trump’s approach is a revival of the mission of empire — acquiring the territories and resources of sovereign peoples.
item.dc:creator: Edward Wong

media:content.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio, right, has been leading the Trump administration’s foreign policy.

item.title: Corrections: Feb. 27, 2026
item.description: Corrections that appeared in print on Friday, Feb. 27, 2026.

item.title: How ‘Heated Rivalry’ Thawed the Chill Between My Father and Me
item.description: A racy show about a romance between male hockey players was not an obvious candidate for me to bond with my 89-year-old father.
item.dc:creator: David Samuel Levinson

item.title: Germany’s Oil and Gas Output Is Dwindling as Prices Rise
item.description: Natural gas production in Germany has fallen about 80 percent in the past two decades even as the country seeks to replace flows from Russia.
item.dc:creator: Stanley Reed and Maximilian Mann

media:content.media:description: The Gas Nord production facility of Harbour Energy Germany in Langwedel-Holtebüttel.

item.title: First They Worked the Case. Then They Made It Personal.
item.description: Nicole Revenaugh and Marisa O’Gara met when they were co-counsel on a case challenging a Kansas law. They didn’t expect to find love.
item.dc:creator: Stella Raine Chu

item.title: He Secured Last-Minute ‘Hamilton’ Tickets Just to See Her
item.description: From finding the hottest ticket in town to converting to Judaism, Julian LeCraw III spared no effort to win over Danielle Toth.
item.dc:creator: Elie Levine

item.title: Changing Up His Routine Led to Love
item.description: Mark Van Wye might have never met Helena Brown had he not decided to take a different Pilates class more than three years ago.
item.dc:creator: Shivani Vora

item.title: Quote of the Day: How a ‘Team From a Small Town Up North’ Is Slaying the European Elites
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Friday, Feburary 27, 2026.

item.title: Pentagon Fires Another Laser at Drone, Prompting New Air Closure
item.description: After the downing of a Customs and Border Protection drone, the F.A.A. closed the airspace above Fort Hancock, Texas.
item.dc:creator: Karoun Demirjian, Kate Kelly, Eric Schmitt and Chris Cameron
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Laser (Light Amplification by Stimulated Emission of Radiation)

media:content.media:description: A police officer walked with a police dog at El Paso International Airport, after the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration lifted its temporary closure of the airspace over El Paso earlier this month.

item.title: Pakistan Strikes Afghanistan in ‘Open War’ Against Taliban Regime
item.description: The airstrikes came hours after Afghan troops had attacked Pakistani border positions and follow months of worsening relations between the neighboring countries.
item.dc:creator: Elian Peltier and Safiullah Padshah

media:content.media:description: The Afghan capital, Kabul. Pakistan bombed major cities in Afghanistan including Kabul on Friday.

item.title: Green Party Defeats Labour in U.K. Special Election, in Blow to Starmer
item.description: The result marks the first time the Greens have won a British parliamentary by-election and signals the frustration of left-leaning voters with Prime Minister Keir Starmer.
item.dc:creator: Michael D. Shear

media:content.media:description: Hannah Spencer, who won a historic victory for the Green Party on Thursday, outside a polling station in the Gorton and Denton district outside Manchester.

item.description: The Jinjiao distillery employs more than 2,000 workers. A manager acknowledged that the market is shrinking but says “China will never abandon baijiu.”
A woman filling baijiu bottles at her store.

item.title: How the S&P 500 Stock Index Became So Skewed to Tech and A.I.
item.description: The shifting composition of big public companies in the stock index shows how lopsided and less dynamic the American economy has become.
item.dc:creator: Jacqueline Gu

item.title: ‘The Pitt’ Season 2, Episode 8 Recap: Unplugged
item.description: Without internet, the Pitt was even more chaotic than usual. This on a national holiday on which people blow up things for fun.
item.dc:creator: Sean T. Collins

media:content.media:description: Nurse Princess (Kristin Villanueva) had to cover for Dana as the charge nurse for a while. Then the internet went out.

item.title: NYT Crossword Answers for Feb. 27, 2026
item.description: Caroline Hand opens our solving weekend with a scintillating New York Times Crossword debut.
item.dc:creator: Sam Corbin

item.title: Google Workers Seek ‘Red Lines’ on Military A.I., Echoing Anthropic
item.description: More than 100 Google A.I. employees sent a letter to Jeff Dean, a chief scientist, opposing Gemini’s use for U.S. surveillance and some autonomous weapons.
item.dc:creator: Tripp Mickle

media:content.media:description: Jeff Dean, the chief scientist of Google DeepMind, Google’s artificial intelligence division, at a company event in 2018.

item.title: Hillary Clinton Denies Ever Meeting Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: The former first lady, senator and secretary of state, Hillary Clinton, told congressional members in a closed-door deposition that she had no dealings with Jeffrey Epstein.
item.dc:creator: Jackeline Luna

item.title: Fact-check: In Trump’s Case for an Attack on Iran, False or Unproven Claims
item.description: Key elements of the Trump administration’s arguments this week for another military campaign against Iran do not hold up.
item.dc:creator: Mark Mazzetti, Edward Wong, David E. Sanger and Julian E. Barnes

media:content.media:credit: Arash Khamooshi for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: People walked past a missile system and banners of Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, Iran’s supreme leader, in Tehran last year.

item.title: Una lancha robada, un tiroteo mortal y un supuesto complot contra Cuba
item.description: El relato del gobierno cubano sobre una supuesta incursión armada en su territorio quedó en entredicho después de que uno de los hombres identificados como ocupantes de la embarcación apareciera en Miami.
item.dc:creator: Frances Robles and Patricia Mazzei

media:content.media:description: Buques guardacostas cubanos atracados en el Puerto de La Habana el jueves.

item.title: Men Charged With Hate Crimes After Trying to Light Woman’s Boots on Fire
item.description: One of the men recorded a live-streamed video as the other made racist and sexual comments during the incident in Manhattan, the police said.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Maslin Nir

item.title: Vance Continues to Criticize Democrats’ Attitude During State of the Union
item.description: Speaking in Wisconsin to support Republicans ahead of the midterm elections, Vice President JD Vance reminded his audience that Democrats had not stood up at the president’s behest on Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Katie Rogers

media:content.media:description: Vice President JD Vance in Plover, Wisc., on Thursday.

item.title: Minnesota Offers Plan to Fight Fraud as Trump Moves to Freeze Funds
item.description: Gov. Tim Walz of Minnesota laid out legislative measures to prevent fraud after a scandal that has upended the political landscape in the state.
item.dc:creator: Ernesto Londoño

media:content.media:credit: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Gov. Tim Walz of Minnesota at a news conference at the State Capitol in St. Paul earlier this month.

item.title: Mamdani’s Gift for Trump: A Front Page Celebrating the President
item.description: What do you bring the president when you visit the White House? Mayor Zohran Mamdani made a choice that seemed to please Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: Emma Goldberg

media:content.media:credit: NY Daily News Archive, via Getty Images
media:content.media:description: The famous New York Daily News front page from Oct. 30, 1975, after President Gerald Ford refused to bail out New York City, which was facing bankruptcy.

item.title: ¿La muerte del Mencho afectará los partidos del Mundial en México?
item.description: Aunque autoridades como la presidenta de México, Claudia Sheinbaum, y el presidente de la FIFA, Gianni Infantino, han intentado proyectar calma tras los hechos, algunos equipos han admitido sentirse nerviosos por jugar en el país.
item.dc:creator: James Wagner

media:content.media:credit: Cristopher Rogel Blanquet para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Un agente de policía patrulla el lunes por el centro histórico de Ciudad de México.

item.title: Trump Ally Expands Inquiry of Former Officials Who Investigated the President
item.description: The office of a prosecutor based in Miami has issued new subpoenas in a wide-ranging inquiry aimed at President Trump’s perceived foes.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Savage
item.category: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

media:content.media:credit: Jefferson Siegel for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Some of President Trump’s allies have hoped that Jason A. Reding Quiñones, the U.S. attorney for the District of Southern Florida, would develop a “grand conspiracy” inquiry.

item.title: Supreme Court Lawyer Who Moonlighted in High-Stakes Poker Is Convicted of Tax Fraud
item.description: The lawyer Thomas C. Goldstein, who co-founded the SCOTUSblog website, hid millions in gambling income from the government, federal prosecutors said.
item.dc:creator: Neil Vigdor

media:content.media:description: Thomas Goldstein represented Epic Games, makers of the popular Fortnite video game, in an antitrust case brought against Apple in the Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, in San Francisco, in 2022.

item.title: Iranians Cite Progress in Talks, but a Marathon Session Produces No Deal
item.description: Representatives of the countries were in Geneva this week to discuss the fate of Iran’s nuclear program.
item.dc:creator: Farnaz Fassihi and David E. Sanger

media:content.media:description: The U.S. special envoy Steve Witkoff, who, with Jared Kushner, Mr. Trump’s son-in-law, is negotiating with Iran’s foreign minister Abbas Araghchi.

item.title: Read Judge Schiltz’s Order
item.description: In a scathing order, the chief federal judge in Minnesota accused federal officials of continuing to disobey judicial orders related to immigration enforcement.

item.title: Judge Says U.S. Is Intentionally Violating the Law on Immigration
item.description: Judge Zahid N. Quraishi said federal prosecutors in New Jersey had lost credibility on immigration issues. He’s the latest federal judge to show impatience with the Trump administration.
item.dc:creator: Jonah E. Bromwich

media:content.media:description: Judge Zahid Quraishi said that the U.S. attorney’s office in his state had lost its credibility and was intentionally violating immigration-related orders.

item.title: Dog Abandoned at Las Vegas Airport Adopted by Responding Police Officer
item.description: The previous owner was arrested and charged with animal abandonment and resisting arrest, police said.
item.dc:creator: Rylee Kirk

media:content.media:description: A dog abandoned by its owner at the Las Vegas airport didn’t need long to find a new home.

item.title: Justice Department Sues 5 States, Most Republican-Led, for Voter Data
item.description: The Trump administration sued Utah, Oklahoma and West Virginia, as well as Kentucky and New Jersey, to obtain unredacted voter registration databases in pursuit of baseless claims of voter fraud.
item.dc:creator: Chris Cameron

media:content.media:description: Election processing in Salt Lake City in 2024. Utah was one of five states sued by the Trump administration on Thursday for voter data.

item.title: After F.B.I. Raid, Los Angeles School Board Discusses Superintendent’s Future
item.description: Board members held an emergency meeting a day after agents raided the home and office of Alberto Carvalho, the Los Angeles Unified School District superintendent. They did not reach a resolution and agreed to reconvene Friday.
item.dc:creator: Dana Goldstein and Shawn Hubler

media:content.media:credit: Philip Cheung for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Los Angeles Unified school board members met Thursday afternoon in an emergency closed session a day after the F.B.I. raid of Alberto Carvalho’s home.

item.title: 32.6 Million Watched Trump’s State of the Union Address, Nielsen Says
item.description: The audience was roughly on par with former President Biden’s final State of the Union address in 2024.
item.dc:creator: John Koblin

media:content.media:credit: Anna Rose Layden for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Congressional staff members watching President Trump’s State of the Union address at the Capitol on Tuesday.

item.title: Trump’s Yes-Men Presidency
item.description: Trump’s State of the Union was a mirror of his administration. On “The Ezra Klein Show,” Ezra and the Times Opinion editor Aaron Retica discuss the yes-man culture surrounding Trump.
item.dc:creator: ‘The Ezra Klein Show’

item.title: Federal Judge Accuses Trump Administration of Repeatedly Disobeying Orders
item.description: The federal judge identified 210 orders issued in 143 cases in Minnesota in which he said Immigration and Customs Enforcement officials had not complied with court orders.
item.dc:creator: Mitch Smith, Ernesto Londoño and Mattathias Schwartz

media:content.media:credit: U.S. District Court of Minnesota, via Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Judge Patrick Schiltz was nominated to the bench by President George W. Bush.

item.title: Russia Launches Major Attack Hours Before U.S.-Ukraine Talks
item.description: Russia unleashed a series of drone and missile strikes on Ukraine on Thursday, injuring at least 20 people and damaging buildings in eight different regions.
item.dc:creator: Meg Felling

media:content.media:description: An apartment building hit by a Russian strike in Zaporizhzhia, Ukraine, on Thursday.

item.title: Edward L. Deci, 83, Dies; Found Self-Determination as a Key to Happiness
item.description: His work with his colleague Richard Ryan changed how psychologists understand human motivation and what people require to flourish.
item.dc:creator: Clay Risen

item.title: Testimony Offers New Details on Justice Dept. Role in Abrego Garcia Prosecution
item.description: A top prosecutor, Robert E. McGuire, painted an extraordinary picture of senior Justice Department leaders peering over his shoulder and hurrying him along.
item.dc:creator: Alan Feuer

media:content.media:description: Kilmar Armando Abrego Garcia and his wife, Jennifer Vasquez Sura, arriving at federal court in Nashville on Thursday.

item.title: N.Y. Man With China Ties Charged With Marijuana Trafficking in Oklahoma
item.description: Sin Tung Chan was a member of a prominent hometown association in the city, one of hundreds of social clubs that often maintain close ties with the Chinese government.
item.dc:creator: Jay Root, Michael Forsythe and Bianca Pallaro

media:content.media:credit: Shuran Huang for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Purple Ray L.L.C., one of two large marijuana farms owned by Sin Tung Chan in rural Oklahoma, was raided on Wednesday.

item.title: A Final Run With Jeff Galloway, the Man Who Helped Americans Finish Marathons
item.description: The distance running icon, who died Wednesday at 80, taught me to endure. In December, we shared his final run.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Friedman

item.title: Block Cuts 40% of Its Work Force Because of Its Embrace of A.I.
item.description: About 4,000 workers will lose their jobs as the payments company does more work with new artificial intelligence tools, its top executive said.
item.dc:creator: Natallie Rocha

media:content.media:description: Jack Dorsey, Block’s top executive, attributed job cuts to his company’s embrace of A.I.

item.title: Jo Ann Bland, Child Activist in Civil Rights Struggle, Dies at 72
item.description: At 11, she was one of the youngest at the 1965 “Bloody Sunday” voting rights march in Selma, Ala., and was injured while crossing the Edmund Pettus Bridge.
item.dc:creator: Sam Roberts

media:content.media:credit: Jessica Rinaldi/The Boston Globe, via Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Ms. Bland, right, was embraced by a crowd crossing the Edmund Pettus Bridge in Selma in 2015 to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the civil rights march.
